SIMD_FORCE_INLINE void GIM_TRIANGLE::get_triangle_transform ( btTransform &  triangle_transform  )  const [inline]

Gets the relative transformation of this triangle.

The transformation is oriented to the triangle normal , and aligned to the 1st edge of this triangle. The position corresponds to vertice 0:

  • triangle normal corresponds to Z axis.
  • 1st normalized edge corresponds to X axis,

SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool GIM_TRIANGLE::get_uv_parameters ( const btVector3 &  point,
const btVector3 &  tri_plane,
GREAL &  u,
GREAL &  v 
) const [inline]

Solve the System for u,v parameters:

u*axe1[i1] + v*axe2[i1] = vecproj[i1] u*axe1[i2] + v*axe2[i2] = vecproj[i2]

sustitute: v = (vecproj[i2] - u*axe1[i2])/axe2[i2]

then the first equation in terms of 'u':

--> u*axe1[i1] + ((vecproj[i2] - u*axe1[i2])/axe2[i2])*axe2[i1] = vecproj[i1]

--> u*axe1[i1] + vecproj[i2]*axe2[i1]/axe2[i2] - u*axe1[i2]*axe2[i1]/axe2[i2] = vecproj[i1]

--> u*(axe1[i1] - axe1[i2]*axe2[i1]/axe2[i2]) = vecproj[i1] - vecproj[i2]*axe2[i1]/axe2[i2]

--> u*((axe1[i1]*axe2[i2] - axe1[i2]*axe2[i1])/axe2[i2]) = (vecproj[i1]*axe2[i2] - vecproj[i2]*axe2[i1])/axe2[i2]

--> u*(axe1[i1]*axe2[i2] - axe1[i2]*axe2[i1]) = vecproj[i1]*axe2[i2] - vecproj[i2]*axe2[i1]

--> u = (vecproj[i1]*axe2[i2] - vecproj[i2]*axe2[i1]) /(axe1[i1]*axe2[i2] - axe1[i2]*axe2[i1])

if 0.0<= u+v <=1.0 then they are inside of triangle

Returns:
false if the point is outside of triangle.This function doesn't take the margin

Definition at line 248 of file gim_tri_collision.h.

00252         {
00253                 btVector3 _axe1 = m_vertices[1]-m_vertices[0];

00257                 GUINT _i2 = (_i1+1)%3;
00258                 if(btFabs(_axe2[_i2])<G_EPSILON)
00259                 {
00260                         u = (_vecproj[_i2]*_axe2[_i1] - _vecproj[_i1]*_axe2[_i2]) /(_axe1[_i2]*_axe2[_i1]  - _axe1[_i1]*_axe2[_i2]);
00261                         v = (_vecproj[_i1] - u*_axe1[_i1])/_axe2[_i1];

00264                 {

00266                         v = (_vecproj[_i2] - u*_axe1[_i2])/_axe2[_i2];
00267                 }
00268 
00269                 if(u<-G_EPSILON)
00270                 {
00271                         return false;
00272                 }
00273                 else if(v<-G_EPSILON)
00274                 {
00275                         return false;
00276                 }
00277                 else
00278                 {

00280                         sumuv = u+v;
00281                         if(sumuv<-G_EPSILON)
00282                         {
00283                                 return false;
00284                         }
00285                         else if(sumuv-1.0f>G_EPSILON)
00286                         {
00287                                 return false;
00288                         }
00289                 }
00290                 return true;
00291         }
